SupportingEvidence: Neuroendocrine markers (CHGB, SERPINI1) and neuronal/axon guidance genes (ROBO1, NRP2, PTN) indicate immature/neuroendocrine-like phenotype consistent with embryonal regions.
Wnt/β-catenin pathway regulators/targets (NKD1, APCDD1, ZNRF3) are characteristic of embryonal hepatoblastoma.
Developmental signaling factors (BMP4, TGFB2) align with a less differentiated embryonal state.
ECM/mesenchymal remodeling genes (LAMC1, ITGA8, BGN, MATN3) are enriched in embryonal/undifferentiated compartments.
SuggestedExperiments: IHC/IF for neuroendocrine markers (CHGA/CHGB, SYP, INSM1).
IHC for β-catenin (nuclear) and sequencing of CTNNB1/APC to assess Wnt activation.
IHC/ISH for subtype markers: fetal (ALB, HNF4A, GLUL) vs embryonal (AFP, DLK1).
Correlate with histopathology to confirm embryonal morphology and exclude macrotrabecular pattern.
